data.title: World War II Flight Training Museum
data.meta_description: 1944-J class of cadets in who learned to fly at Douglas, GA during World War II.
data.text:
He was inducted into the U.S. Army on the 30th of December 1942 in Altoona, Pennsylvania. In June, 1945, he was stationed at Laredo Gunnery School in the 2126th AAF Bomb Unit, when he had a landing accident crash 2 miles south of Carrizo Springs, TX in an AT-11 due to a mechanical failure.

He was a 1st LT and was among those selected by President Truman for the Regular Army in 1947 [Source: The Indiana Gazette (Indiana, Pennsylvania), 31 May 1947, Sat, Page 2].

Interestingly he had four military serial numbers prior to his Social security number. His enlisted number was 33568415; his officer's serial number was O-839716; his regular army serial number was O-48887: his USAF officer's serial number was O-13539A.

Flight Officer and pilot, per veteran gravesite information on Ancestry.com and FindAGrave.

On Mar. 4, 1945 while assigned to the 2126th AAFBU, he was co-pilot on a B-24H (42-95403) when it had a mechanical failure or fire that resulted in a belly landing crash at Loredo AAF, TX. The pilot and 3 others were killed, but Clausen was not seriously injured. The accident occurred while the bomber was on a routine training flight.
